name: All keys should be located at the top of the record definition, and listed in order of importance (PeopleSoft)
description: This quality rule reports Record Definitions having keys not located at the top of the Record Definition.
output:
This report lists all the PeopleSoft Records with at least one key not at the top of the record definition.
It provides the following information: 
- PeopleSoft Record full name.
rationale:
The order of columns having the 'Key' attribute drives how the compound index is built.
The order is good if the resulting index satisfies most of the queries using the index.
A wrong location (not at the top) or a wrong order will impact the usage of the index, and thus the performance of the queries.
reference:
See section Ordering Keys at :
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E41633_01/pt853pbh1/eng/pt/tapd/task_SettingRecordFieldProperties-077634.html

Background on Oracle compound / composite index column ordering :
http://www.dba-oracle.com/t_composite_index_multi_column_ordering.htm
remediation:
Using Application Designer's Record Field Properties dialog:
- locate the field having the 'Key' attribute at the top of the Record definition
- order them in the order of importance for the SQL engine execution plan : put the most restrictive field value first (the column with the highest unique values) because this will trim-down the result set.
total: Number of PeopleSoft Records with key (ADDED)
